properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. An area of snow is moving across the area this morning. The snow may become heavy at times resulting in reduced visibility. Total snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm can be expected by the time the snow comes to an end this afternoon. The period of heaviest snowfall will likely occur between about 5 and 10 A.M. The morning commute will likely be impacted and motorists are advised to exercise caution and alter their travel plans as needed. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-22T20:02:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T14:40:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2385391103.2021
Area: Uxbridge - Beaverton - Northern Durham Region, Pickering - Oshawa - Southern Durham Region, Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions tonight and Tuesday in Naujaat. Strong northwest winds with gusts to 70 km/h will affect Naujaat beginning overnight tonight. Blizzard conditions, with near-zero visibility in blowing snow, will result. Blizzard conditions will ease on Tuesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Town Of Turtleford.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the town of Turtleford. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water the Turtleford water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A multi-day episode of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme cold temperatures near minus 55 and minus 60 will return overnight. Near extreme values are expected through the day today. These extreme cold temperatures may persist through to the end of the week. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T07:31:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T15:32:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0972525486.2021
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, rain and strong winds are expected. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Total rainfall: 5 to 10 mm, except potentially higher amounts over the southern Avalon and Burin Peninsulas. Maximum wind gusts: up to 80 km/h. Locations: Burin and Avalon Peninsulas. Time span: Tuesday afternoon until overnight Tuesday night. Remarks: Snow or rain will begin near noon Tuesday or later in the afternoon before changing over to rain early in the evening. Strong winds will also develop late Tuesday afternoon, with the highest gusts along the coast in the evening. Conditions will improve Tuesday night as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries.. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T11:43:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T19:44:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3169407707.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall expected beginning Tuesday. Total snowfall: near 10 cm, with higher amounts possible inland and over higher terrain. Maximum wind gusts: up to 80 km/h. Locations: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity to Connaigre. Time span: midday Tuesday through Tuesday night. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across southwestern Newfoundland on Tuesday before changing to rain or drizzle in the evening. Strong winds will cause a brief period blowing snow and reduced visibility in some locations near midday on Tuesday. Conditions will improve Tuesday night as rain tapers to drizzle and flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T11:52:02-00:00

Area: Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:

The snow will likely become heavy at times this afternoon, and will result in poor visibilities in heavy snow over portions of the area. properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow is expected. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm, with locally higher amounts possible. Locations: central and northeastern Newfoundland. Time span: Tuesday afternoon to near midday on Wednesday. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across central and northeastern Newfoundland Tuesday afternoon. Winds will strengthen Tuesday night causing blowing snow and reduced visibility, mainly over exposed areas. In the northeast snow will taper to freezing drizzle on Tuesday night before changing back to snow Wednesday morning. Over central areas, snow will continue into Wednesday morning with further, but minor, accumulations. Snow will taper off over all areas by Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-23T11:44:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T19:45:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4206803447.2021

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A frontal system laden with subtropical moisture will continue to give snow to parts of the Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass section. As snow levels hover around 1200 metres today, rain will fall over most of the highway with snow expected at higher elevations. The snow is forecast to taper off to a few flurries overnight tonight with total accumulations possibly reaching 35 cm. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T05:00:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T13:01:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0441451884.2021
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system moving across the Columbia region will continue to give snow to Yoho Park - Kootenay Park. Total snowfall accumulations nearing 20 cm can be expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries late this evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-23T03:57:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-22T11:58:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2682397534.2021
Area: Yoho Park - Kootenay Park
